frameDefinitions: In this frame, there is a Part of a Whole in which the Part is defined with respect to the canonical or inherent orientation of the Whole.
A perceptible Figure shows up against a Ground location due to Light shining on/from it, its salience possibly dependent on a Cause_of_shine.

A Figure is located relative to a (presumably more easily located) Ground, asserting that the Figure lies (approximately) on line from the Ground whose direction is established by semantic types of the particular LUs.
This frame is about Items in the state of occupying a certain Rank within a hierarchy.
Generally without overall (translational) motion,  an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled.
This frame contains nouns denoting a rank or level within an established hierarchy.
frameExamples: The plane landed 10 miles due <t>north</t> of Lake Travis in an empty field .
He <t>ranks</t> second in his class in mathematics.
David <t>placed</t> his briefcase on the floor.
listRoleDefinitions: A piece of a larger <fen>Whole</fen>.
An undivided entity having all its <fen>Part</fen>s.
The percept which is perceived at a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The location of the phenomenon.
The <fen>Light</fen> which is emitted.  In this frame, it is usually incorporated in verbs and adjectives, and is the denotation of many of the nouns.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Figure</fen> is observed against the <fen>Ground</fen> location due to <fen>Light</fen> shining on it.
The spatial setting in which the <fen>Figure</fen> shows up against a <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.

The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location in a certain direction specified by the particular LU. The <fen>Figure</fen> can be an entity or an event.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.
The <fen>Rank</fen> which the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The Item which occupies the Rank in the hierarchy.
The dimension along which the ranking is defined.
The time at which/period over which the <fen>Item</fen> occupies the <fen>Rank</fen>
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to move.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the object that changes location during the Placing.
The role <fen>Goal</fen> is the location where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up. This role is profiled by words in this frame.
<fen>Time</fen> is when the Placing occurs
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates where the Placing occurs.
The Rank itself, usually denoted by the noun.
An entity which holds a particular <fen>Rank</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The top <fex>shelf</fex> of the bookcase was lying on the floor.
The show takes place in the West wing <fex>of the White House</fex>.
Hot coals glowed <fex>behind the fire grate</fex>.
<fex>In the morning</fex> the grass glistened with dew
<fex>Outside</fex> something was shimmering on the shore.
He was north of the park <fex>on Friday</fex>.
He ranks second in his class <fex>in mathematics</fex>.
Jim ranked as thirty-second degree Mason <fex>in 1970</fex>.
<fex>The waiter</fex> placed the food on the table.
The waiter placed <fex>the food</fex> on the table.
The waiter placed the food <fex>on the table</fex>.
Grass , which is sown with clover , provides rich pasture for cattle in summer and the clover is <fex>another plant which</fex> puts nitrogen into the soil .
Smithers had placed the table there <fex>the night before</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Johns Hopkins School of Professional Studies in Business and Education
the Center for Teaching and Learning
